title: 'Significant step forward': PM Modi hails Trump's Gaza peace plan; affirms India's support
content: Prime Minister Modi welcomed Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan, calling it a significant step towards ending the conflict. Trump issued an ultimatum to Hamas to accept the 20-point deal by Sunday evening, warning of severe repercussions if they refuse. He claimed the plan, which includes sparing Hamas fighters, has global backing for lasting Middle East peace.

title: Season’s first cyclone, ‘Shakhti’, forms over Arabian Sea; IMD warns of high sea activity
content: The season's first Arabian Sea cyclonic storm, 'Shakhti', intensified on Friday, currently positioned west-southwest of Dwarka. Expected to become a severe cyclonic storm, it is unlikely to significantly impact Indian landmass, though remnants may bring rain to Gujarat. Sea conditions will be very rough, prompting warnings for fishermen. Meanwhile, Maharashtra anticipates light to moderate rain due to another system.

title: 'Arbitrary, capricious': Lawsuit filed against Trump’s H-1B visa fee hike
content: US President Donald Trump's new $100,000 fee for H-1B visas faces a federal lawsuit filed by unions, employers, and religious groups. Plaintiffs argue Trump lacks authority to unilaterally impose such a fee, which they claim could foster corruption and stifle innovation.

title: Gaza peace plan: Hamas agrees to free all Israeli hostages; nods for negotiations
content: Hamas announced its agreement to release all Israeli hostages, alive or deceased, under US President Donald Trump’s Gaza proposal, following his ultimatum. Trump warned of "unprecedented consequences" if a peace deal wasn't reached by Sunday evening, promoting his 20-point plan for Middle East peace, which he claimed had broad regional support.

title: Asia Cup drama: 'What Naqvi is doing is absolutely right' - PCB chief gets backing
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Yousuf has publicly supported ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi amidst the Asia Cup trophy controversy. India, after winning the 2025 final, declined to receive the trophy from Naqvi, prompting BCCI to demand his removal. Yousuf criticized India's refusal as 'filmy,' asserting they should have accepted it as per rules, underscoring escalating tensions between the cricket boards.

title: H-1B visa debate heats up: US senator writes to TCS; questions on H-1B hiring
content: US Senators Charles Grassley and Richard Durbin have challenged Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) over its H-1B visa hiring practices amid significant global layoffs. A letter to CEO Krithi Krithivasan expresses concern about high American tech unemployment while TCS secured approval for 5,505 H-1B workers in FY2025, despite announcing 12,000 global job cuts.

title: GST cuts: Navratri sales hit 10-year high; retailers report 25-100% sales growth
content: GST reduction on 375 items boosted consumer spending. Navratri sales reached a decade high. Government officials cited industry data. Families upgraded vehicles and bought white goods. This turned festive cheer into record consumption. Brands and retailers reported sales growth. This provided a boost for India's consumption-driven economy. Car bookings also saw an increase.

title: Car rams steps of Los Angeles City Hall; cardboard sign has message for Trump
content: Los Angeles City Hall was evacuated Friday afternoon after a car crashed into its steps. Police are attempting to contact the driver, who displayed a sign reading "I need ur help" and referencing Donald Trump. The mayor's office confirmed the evacuation out of caution, with no immediate injuries reported.

title: US government shutdown extended after Senate votes fail again
content: The US government shutdown entered its third day with no resolution as Republican and Democratic leaders remain deadlocked. Republicans insist on their short-term funding bill, while Democrats refuse without their input, citing public opinion blaming the GOP. Both parties' bills have failed, and the GOP needs five more Democratic votes to advance their proposal.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: Want to stay on world map? Stop backing terror: Army chief to Pak
content: Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi sternly warned Pakistan to cease terrorism support or risk its global standing, referencing Operation Sindoor. He revealed over 100 Pakistani soldiers and numerous terrorists were killed, and nine facilities destroyed in precise strikes after the Pahalgam attack. Dwivedi stressed India's future provocations would not go unanswered, urging heightened readiness and modernization among troops.

title: 'Stop bombing Gaza': Trump to Israel as Hamas agrees to free hostages; urges peace
content: US President Donald Trump reacted to Hamas's announcement to release all Israeli hostages, stating the group seemed ready for "lasting peace." He urged Israel to halt Gaza bombing for safe release, following his ultimatum to Hamas for a peace deal by Sunday evening. Hamas agreed to his proposal, ready for talks on Trump's 20-point peace plan.

title: Ahead of Pak game, snake scare headlines India training session
content: During their training session at R Premadasa Stadium on Friday, the Indian women's cricket team encountered a non-venomous common rat snake. This familiar reptile, often seen at the venue, moved along drains, creating a light-hearted moment for players and staff. India is preparing for their World Cup match against Pakistan.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
content: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Manchester synagogue attack: Police say suspect on bail in rape case- Key points
content: A suspected terror attack outside a Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur left two Jewish men dead and three injured. Police fatally shot assailant Jihad Al-Shamie, 35, a British national of Syrian descent, who was on bail for rape and possibly influenced by extreme Islamist ideology. Six others were arrested on terror charges.

title: Ex-LSU receiver Kyren Lacy’s lawyer says he is wrongly blamed in fatal crash
content: Former LSU player Kyren Lacy's suicide, ahead of negligent homicide charges, sparks controversy. His attorney, Matt Ory, challenges the Louisiana State Police investigation into a fatal accident. New surveillance footage reportedly shows Lacy was back in his lane before impact, contradicting official accounts. Ory cites inconsistencies and missing witness testimony, suggesting evidence doesn't support Lacy's culpability, deepening the tragedy.

title: Canada: Khalistan radicals try to set fire to Ontario cinema; twice in a week
content: Pro-Khalistan elements twice attacked an Ontario cinema, attempting arson and firing gunshots, leading the theatre to halt Hindi movie screenings. Designated terror group SFJ subsequently demanded Canada ban all "Made In India" films, alleging they are political weapons for Modi's regime. The theatre CEO confirmed halting Indian films due to safety concerns following these targeted incidents.

title: Lakers vs Suns Preseason Game 1: Full injury report for October 3, 2025
content: Robert Griffin III and his family miraculously survived a terrifying car accident in Fort Worth, Texas, where their van spun and hit barriers, but everyone escaped uninjured. Griffin expressed immense relief and gratitude online following the incident. He is now preparing to commentate a Big 12 game in his home state, transitioning from a star player to a sports analyst.

title: Usman Nurmagomedov vs Paul Hughes 2: PFL Champions Series 3 results - highlights
content: The PFL Champions Series 3 in Dubai delivered an electric atmosphere, highlighted by Usman Nurmagomedov's successful lightweight title defense against Paul Hughes in their highly anticipated rematch. Nurmagomedov dominated with grappling and striking, securing a decision victory. The event also showcased other thrilling bouts across various weight divisions, establishing new contenders and champions.

title: NFL trade rumors: 49ers, Ravens eye Giants’ star Kayvon Thibodeaux
content: San Francisco 49ers seek a top pass rusher after Nick Bosa's injury. They show interest in New York Giants' defensive end Kayvon Thibodeaux. Giants are assessing their defensive line depth. They might consider trading Thibodeaux for draft picks or a player. This potential move could strengthen the 49ers' defense. The trade deadline approaches.

title: Horrific! Stray dogs attack foreign coaches; fifth incident at JLN stadium
content: Stray dog attacks at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi raised serious safety concerns after two foreign coaches and a security guard were bitten on Friday. These incidents, following previous unreported attacks, disrupted the event. Despite efforts to clear the stadium, individuals feeding dogs led to their re-entry, prompting strengthened preventive measures.

title: Kidney transplant breakthrough: Scientists create universal donor to fight shortage
content: Scientists converted a type A kidney into a type O universal donor kidney. Enzymes removed specific antigens from the organ. The converted kidney worked normally for two days in a brain-dead patient. Antigens then reappeared. This research shows a path to reduce kidney transplant waiting times. It could benefit many type O patients.

title: Bill-grimage: Rishikesh costliest desi destination; Mumbai top biz spot
content: Rishikesh remains India's priciest hotel destination for the second consecutive year, despite a marginal RevPAR decline. The Indian hospitality sector experienced a robust fiscal year, driven by booming domestic leisure travel and record occupancy rates. Mumbai, Delhi, and Hyderabad emerged as key business hubs, with significant expansion planned across 177 new markets.

title: Arthur Jones’ 2025 net worth: Contracts, career earnings & financial legacy
content: Arthur Jones, the Super Bowl champion and brother to Jon and Chandler Jones, passed away at 39 on October 3, 2025. Despite gross NFL earnings exceeding $20 million, his estimated net worth in 2025 is $4-8 million after deductions and career setbacks. He is remembered for his positive impact beyond finances.

title: Op Sindoor: Downed 12-13 Pak jets, says IAF chief; India also hit F-16s
content: IAF Chief Marshal A P Singh confirmed significant Pakistani losses during Operation Sindoor. He stated 9-10 Pakistani fighters and special aircraft were destroyed. This included F-16s and JF-17s. Satellite imagery showed damage to radar sites and airbases. IAF also shot down a special mission aircraft over 300km away. India ended hostilities after meeting its objectives.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced: Breaks down in court; apologises to family
content: Sean “Diddy” Combs was sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution charges, though acquitted of more serious sex-trafficking. Judge Arun Subramanian condemned his abuse, citing his power and resources. Diddy broke down in court, apologizing to his family and Cassie Ventura, attributing his “disgusting” actions to drug use and expressing deep remorse.

title: Now, 12 kids’ deaths linked to cough syrup in MP, Raj; Centre issues advisory
content: Alarm bells are ringing as 12 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan died following complications from cough syrup use, prompting a central advisory against prescribing such medications to children under two. While the Union health ministry found no contamination in MP samples, the cause of kidney failure remains a mystery. Rajasthan also reported deaths, banning a specific syrup pending investigation.

title: Jail tyranny: 74% of prisoners are undertrials; systemic delays persist
content: India's prisons are grappling with a staggering 3.9 lakh undertrials, constituting nearly three-fourths of all inmates, despite a marginal improvement. Delays in investigations, a severe shortage of judges (21 per million), and limited legal aid are key contributors to this persistent issue. Consequently, jails remain critically overcrowded at 121% occupancy, underscoring a deep-seated crisis within the justice system.

title: Bihar elections: Pre-poll schemes put youth, women in focus; new policies unveiled
content: PM Modi will inaugurate Jan Nayak Karpoori Thakur Skill University, signaling a strategic outreach to backward communities in poll-bound Bihar. This anchors a series of over Rs 62,000 crore youth empowerment initiatives, including revamped schemes for graduate allowances, women's self-employment, student credit cards, and new bodies like Bihar Yuva Aayog, alongside upgrades to educational institutions.

title: Arthur Jones cause of death: How did the Ravens’ Super Bowl champion die at 39
content: Former NFL star and Super Bowl champion Arthur Jones died suddenly at 39, with his cause of death unconfirmed. A key defensive player in the Baltimore Ravens' Super Bowl XLVII victory, his passing deeply saddened the sports world. Jones, from a renowned athletic family, is remembered for his positive spirit and legacy.

title: India slams Pakistan over POK unrest: Cites human rights abuses; deaths
content: India strongly condemned Pakistan's "oppressive approach" and human rights abuses amidst violent protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK), where eight deaths are confirmed. India reiterated POK's integral status, demanding Pakistan vacate illegally occupied territories. Pakistan's PM expressed concern, dispatching a delegation to address the unrest, which stemmed from failed talks with protesters over resource plundering.

title: 'Bangladesh govt has failed minorities', India pulls up Yunus; slams 'blame game'
content: India rejected Bangladesh's allegations that it fueled unrest in Khagrachhari, stating Dhaka's interim government failed to maintain law and order and protect minorities. New Delhi urged Bangladesh to investigate local extremists for violence and land grab in the Chittagong Hill Tracts. This followed clashes over an alleged gang rape, killing three and injuring dozens.

title: OctaFX case: Illegal trading platform minted Rs 800cr; Indians lost Rs 22k cr
content: The ED is investigating OctaFX, an illegal online trading platform, for laundering thousands of crores from India through transcontinental operations involving cryptocurrencies and international payment gateways. This platform alone generated Rs 800 crore in nine months, with funds layered via fake import services. Indians lost over Rs 22,800 crore in similar financial frauds in 2024.

title: Zubeen's death: Sitting HC judge to head probe panel; ED, I-T dept likely to join
content: Zubeen Garg's death probe escalates to potential murder. Four arrests are made. A judicial commission will form Saturday. ED and I-T may join the financial crime investigation against Shyamkanu Mahanta. Over 60 FIRs are filed across Assam. Zubeen's drummer and co-singer received 14-day custody. The Chief Minister speaks of a coordinated conspiracy.

title: Karur tragedy: High court raps Vijay for fleeing stampede; orders SIT probe
content: Madras High Court ordered an SIT probe against actor-politician Vijay and his TVK for a stampede that killed 41 in Karur and abandoning cadres. The court also mandated a hit-and-run case against Vijay for two vehicle accidents, condemning his party's irresponsible attitude and prohibiting highway rallies until SOPs are formed.

title: HC relief for family: Officer in coma since 2023; tax dept told to clear dues
content: Rajasthan HC ordered the commercial taxes department to release the full salary and arrears of officer Surendra Singh Chawra within seven days. Chawra has been in a coma since August 2023, and his salary was stopped after a year. The court cited his family's distress and medical expenses, mandating payment before Diwali.

title: National Medical Commission still to act on junketeering doctors
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has yet to act against 30 doctors found guilty of accepting a foreign trip funded by pharma company AbbVie. This delay stems from four out of five vacant posts in its Ethics and Medical Registration Board, hindering action. NMC's new chairperson confirmed the issue, stating a temporary board is being considered to address pending matters.

title: Calm after chaos: Leh hospital heals Sept 24 victims; bullet wounds still haunt
content: Sonam Norboo Memorial Hospital in Leh experienced unprecedented chaos on September 24 when protests led to bullet injuries, a first for many doctors. Initially treating stone-pelting victims, the hospital quickly shifted to emergency mode for the 70 injured, including four fatalities. Police now guard the premises where some accused are still being treated.

title: Historic first: Church of England names woman archbishop; conservatives push back
content: Dame Sarah Mullally will become the first woman to lead the Church of England. She was named Archbishop of Canterbury-designate. Her confirmation is set for January 2026. Mullally previously served as Bishop of London and chief nursing officer. The appointment received praise from Hindu leaders. However, a conservative Anglican group expressed opposition to her leadership.

title: Bombay HC sacks two judges: Serious misconduct cited; graft probe ordered
content: Bombay HC dismissed judges Dhananjay Nikam and Irfan Shaikh for serious misconduct. Nikam faced dismissal after allegedly demanding a Rs 5 lakh bribe for bail, with the HC denying his anticipatory bail due to incriminating evidence. Shaikh was dismissed following a 2022 road accident, though he denies the allegations and plans to challenge the decision.

title: Anil Ambani loan fraud plea: Bombay HC dismisses petition; SBI action stands
content: Bombay High Court on Friday dismissed Anil Ambani's petition challenging SBI's decision to classify Reliance Communications' loan account as "fraud." Ambani argued natural justice was flouted and SBI's action was arbitrary, denying him a personal hearing. The court found no merit in his plea, allowing Ambani to potentially approach the Supreme Court.

title: Bihar: Teens returning from Durga Puja fair hit by Vande Bharat; 4 dead, 1 injured
content: Tragedy struck Purnia early Friday as four teenagers, aged 13-15, were fatally hit by the Jogbani-Danapur Vande Bharat Express while crossing railway tracks. Returning from a Durga Puja fair, low visibility around 4:40 AM likely prevented them from noticing the high-speed train. One survivor is critically injured. Railways have launched an investigation, urging public caution near tracks.

title: Cyclone Shakti: Season’s 1st storm over Arabian Sea; currently near Gujarat’s Dwarka
content: The season's first cyclonic storm, 'Cyclone Shakti,' has intensified in the Arabian Sea, currently west-southwest of Gujarat. While it will strengthen into a severe cyclonic storm, it is not expected to significantly impact the Indian landmass, though rough sea conditions will persist. Fishermen are advised to avoid venturing into the sea.

title: Tariff war: Will up India imports, address trade imbalance, says Putin; slams US
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced plans to increase imports from India. This aims to balance trade between the two nations. He expressed confidence India will continue energy imports despite US pressure. Putin praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership. He looks forward to his December visit to India. The two countries marked 25 years of partnership.

title: Nagpur hotelier, wife killed in Italy crash: 3 kids critical; govt aids family
content: Nagpur hotelier Javed Akhtar and his wife Nadira tragically died in a road accident in Italy's Tuscany region on Thursday. Their three children, Arzoo, Zezel, and Shifa, sustained life-threatening injuries in the horrific mini-bus collision. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is coordinating with the Indian embassy for repatriation and the children's care, as the family's European tour ended in disaster.

title: Chhattisgarh HC: Dignified cremation part of right to life; orders revamp of sites
content: Chhattisgarh High Court has declared the right to a dignified death and cremation a fundamental right under Article 21. This ruling followed a Chief Justice's visit to a "pathetic" Bilaspur cremation ground. The court mandated the State to provide decent facilities, issuing an 11-point directive for immediate improvements like sanitation, lighting, and functional crematoria, demanding affidavits from top officials.

title: Aces' bench leads way in Game 1 win vs. Mercury
content: Dana Evans (21 points) led an Aces bench that outscored the Mercury's reserves 41-16 en route to an 89-86 win in Game 1 of the WNBA Finals on Friday night.

title: Engelbert vows to 'do better,' denies Clark remark
content: WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert said there were "inaccuracies" in some of the comments attributed to her by Napheesa Collier earlier this week, but acknowledged she has to "do better" in growing her relationship with players.

title: Boone fires back at Jays broadcaster: 'He's wrong'
content: The Yankees landed in Toronto with some bulletin board material ahead of the ALDS, courtesy of Blue Jays television color analyst and former major leaguer Buck Martinez.

title: Schlittler: Fan heckling of family 'crossed the line'
content: Yankees starter Cam Schlittler on Friday said Red Sox fans "crossed the line" by harassing family members, including his mother, on social media ahead of his Game 3 start in the AL Wild Card Series.

title: Schumaker to manage Rangers on 4-year deal
content: Skip Schumaker, the 2023 National League Manager of the Year with the Marlins, was hired as Rangers manager, agreeing Friday night on a four-year contract.

title: Ravens rule out QB Jackson due to hamstring
content: After not practicing all week, quarterback Lamar Jackson has been ruled out for the Ravens, who will be without four Pro Bowlers in all against the Texans.

title: Tajh Ariza, ex-NBA veteran's son, picks Oregon
content: Top-25 recruit Tajh Ariza has committed to Oregon, he announced Friday, as the son of former NBA veteran Trevor Ariza chose the Ducks over USC.

title: Ex-Ravens, Syracuse DL Arthur Jones dies at 39
content: Arthur Jones, a defensive lineman who spent his first four NFL seasons in Baltimore and won a Super Bowl with the Ravens, has died. He was 39.

title: 🤞🏽 Can Purdue end Swift album drop 'curse'?
content: Purdue is 4-11 in its first game after a Taylor Swift album drops -- and 0-10 when that game falls within seven days of a release.

title: Critiques from former players and Dabo himself: Can Clemson change the narrative?
content: Frustrations are high at Clemson. Dabo Swinney and former players aren't shying away from the issues.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: 13 more NFL Week 5 games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: Here's everything you need to know. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: Man United need to face reality: Amorim is not the club's biggest issue
content: Man United's decision-making is driven by the idea of where they think they ought to be, not where they are.

title: Man United draw vs. champions Chelsea signals power shift
content: Chelsea have dominated the WSL for six seasons, but Friday showed the Blues' grip on the league is weakening.

title: How The Rock transformed his body -- and mind -- into Mark Kerr
content: Becoming Mark Kerr, a 6-foot-3, 260-pound ex-MMA fighter, included a process unlike any other during Johnson's acting career.

title: Phillies' 9-9-9 Challenge box for 2025 postseason to feature 'fun size' hot dogs
content: The Phillies' Challenge box will offer "fun size" hot dogs and "petite" beers, as well as a built-in scoreboard for fans to track their progress.

title: The time for experimentation is over: USMNT squad sees Pochettino's World Cup vision come into focus
content: Mauricio Pochettino has been experimenting with his USMNT lineup for some time, but judging by his October squad, his World Cup team is taking shape.

title: Tottenham takeover: Top scenes from Vikings-Browns in London
content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mexico's Mora on Arsenal, City, Madrid, Barça radar
content: Mexico teenager Gilberto Mora is being tracked by Arsenal, Manchester City, Real Madrid and Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Fantasy hockey cheat sheet: The names you need to know when you draft your team
content: The fantasy hockey cheat sheet has everything you need to prepare for the draft on one printable PDF.

title: Give me a reason to draft this guy! Late-round picks
content: When you're in the late rounds of your draft, here are the players you should look at and the key reason why.

title: "Truly Sorry For It All": What 'Diddy' Told Judge Arun Subramanian In Court
content: In his last-ditch effort for freedom, Combs apologised to Casandra Ventura and a woman who testified under the name Jane. He spent much of his 12 minutes at the mic detailing how he'd lost his freedom, and how he'd failed as a parent.

title: "Israel Must Stop Bombing Gaza": Trump As Hamas Agrees To Free Hostages
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday called on Israel to "immediately stop the bombing of Gaza", shortly after Hamas accepted parts of his Gaza peace plan.

title: 2 Indians Jailed For 5 Years For Robbing Sex Workers In Singapore Hotels
content: Two men from India, accused of robbing and assaulting two sex workers in hotel rooms while holidaying in Singapore, were each sentenced to five years and one month in prison, along with 12 strokes of the cane on Friday.

title: Ceasefire, Prisoner Swap, Aid Access: Hamas' Conditions For Hostage Deal
content: Hamas accepted certain key parts of the Trump plan, including ending the war, Israel's withdrawal, the release of Israeli hostages and Palestinian captives, aid and recovery efforts, and an opposition to Palestinian expulsion from the territory.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport To Be Named After DB Patil, Says Devendra Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that Navi Mumbai International Airport will be named after late Loknete D B Patil.

title: Video: US Kills 4 In Latest Attack On Alleged Drug Boat Near Venezuela
content: US forces carried out a strike on an alleged drug-smuggling boat off the coast of Venezuela on Friday, killing four people, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said.

title: Trump Says Hamas Ready For Peace, Urges Israel To Stop Bombing Gaza
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he believed Hamas was ready for peace and told Israel to stop bombing Gaza, after the Palestinian militant group declared it was ready to free hostages under his ceasefire plan.

title: "Privileged Strategic Partnership": Ministry On 25 Years Of India-Russia Ties
content: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal hailed the completion of 25 years of the India-Russia strategic partnership on Friday, saying that both countries enjoy a "special, privileged strategic partnership."

title: Hamas Agrees To Free All Israeli Hostages Under Trump's Gaza Plan
content: President Donald Trump told Israel on Friday to immediately stop bombing Gaza after Hamas agreed to release hostages and some other terms in a US plan to end the war, but vexing issues like disarmament appeared unresolved.

title: Bihar Polls: PM Modi To Announce Rs 1,000 Monthly Aid For 5 Lakh Graduates
content: In a significant development pertaining to youth progress, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to introduce a series of initiatives focused on young individuals, with a cumulative investment exceeding Rs. 62,000 crore.

title: 4.5 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Pakistan
content: An earthquake of magnitude 4.5 hit Pakistan on Saturday at 01:59 IST (Indian Standard Time), as per National Center for Seismology.

title: Trump Says "Everybody Will Be Treated Fairly" In Gaza Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he believed Hamas was ready for "lasting peace" and told Israel to stop bombing Gaza, after the Palestinian militant group declared it was ready to free hostages under his ceasefire plan.

title: Munich Airport Closed Again, Pilot Blames Drone Sightings
content: Munich airport was forced to halt operations again late on Friday over suspected drone sightings, a day after drones caused more than 30 flights to be cancelled there and left nearly 3,000 passengers stranded.

title: Hamas Says Trump Call For Israel To Stop Bombing Gaza Is "Encouraging"
content: Hamas on Saturday said statements by US President Donald Trump calling on Israel to stop bombing Gaza are "encouraging", expressing readiness to immediately negotiate for the release of hostages and an end to the war.

title: US Considers $1 Trump Coin To Mark 250th Independence Celebrations
content: The U.S. Treasury is considering making a $1 coin featuring President Donald Trump to commemorate 250 years since the declaration of American independence in 2026, it said on Friday.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Jailed For Over 4 Years In Sex Trafficking Case
content: Sean 'Diddy' Combs was sentenced Friday to 4 years and 2 months in prison in case involving sex workers, violence and "freak-offs."

title: What We Know About Morocco's GenZ 212 Protests
content: A youth collective calling itself GenZ 212, led by a group of unknown organisers, has taken authorities in Morocco by surprise with a series of protests demanding reforms to public health and education.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Cries As Judge Weighs Prison Term
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs ' sentencing hearing in a sordid case involving his girlfriends and male sex workers opened Friday with prosecutors arguing the hip-hop mogul should be locked up for years while his children tearfully asked the judge for mercy.

title: Extra Fee For Cash-On-Delivery? Minister Promises Crackdown On 'Dark Patterns'
content: Cracking down on 'dark patterns' employed by e-commerce companies, Consumer Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi has said firms that charge extra for cash-on-delivery will now face action.

title: Hoist The Jolly Manga: Gen Z Protesters Rally To One Piece Pirate Flag
content: Born in the cult manga series "One Piece", the cartoon skull and crossbones has in recent weeks become the flag of anti-establishment demonstrations worldwide.

title: Why Tommy Castellanos sets up FSU for success vs. Miami
content: a storm brewing in Tallahassee, and it's more than just the weather forecast . one team thrives on pressure, while the other thrives in it . what happens Saturday could reshape the entire ACC title race .

title: Rollins creates more animosity with Cody, Orton
content: "SmackDown" was a great week of making next week's show feel like an extension of Crown Jewel . we also saw the vision pick up a massive win while Seth Rollins continues to question himself . he is fueled by his desire for revenge and validation .

title: Bills' 'Cold Front' Rivalry uniforms, Bucs and Seahawks' throwbacks top Week 5 threads
content: the Buffalo Bills will rock their all-white "Cold Front" threads against the new England Patriots on "Sunday Night Football" there's a chrome, iridescent charging buffalo on the sleeves and a buffalo as a helmet decal .

title: An all-time hater and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .

title: Seattle Mariners' crab helmet tops 2025 new ballpark grub
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the Seattle Mariners have a helmet full of crab claws for the postseason . they have an exclusive jaws milkshake and souvenir cup to celebrate the movie's 50th anniversary .

title: Why Alabama could move ahead early against Vandy
content: all odds by ESPN BET No. 16 Vanderbilt Commodores at no. 10 Alabama Crimson Tide at 3:30 p.m. ET, ABC Line: Alabama -10.5, 3-1 . a 5-0 win over alabama puts the team ahead of the playoffs . it's the kind of matchup that makes you pause before firing a bet .

title: Haaland on pace to surpass Messi and Ronaldo's best seasons. Is that good for City?
content: pep Guardiola was trying to verbalize what made his team so different from their competitors . his wingers defended like defensive midfielders, his attacking midfielders facilitated the central runs of his wales . he said: "we play leftist football"

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: Air Force's alternate uniforms inspired by F-16 headline top threads for Week 6
content: the threads will be worn for the first time Saturday as air force faces a fellow service academy . the uniforms' connection with the F-16 is extensive, with tributes to the fighter jet everywhere from the helmet to the pants . details on the jersey include two patches for the player's name .

title: MLB playoff mega-preview: World Series odds, likely MVPs and more
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs are rolling along with all four game 1s starting Saturday . the playoffs will begin on saturday . all four teams will face each other in a series rematch . a team temperature is based on Bill James' formula for determining how "hot" or "cold" they are .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: What -- if anything -- makes the Dodgers different than every defending MLB champ of the past 25 years?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers are 15 games above .500 in the national league division series . a sense of uneasiness lingered in a meeting with manager Dave Roberts . "he was talking to us about the importance of what was in front of us," says infielder .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Way-too-early 2026 top-50 rankings
content: DH/SP Shohei Ohtani and New York Yankees OF Aaron Judge pick the first drafts in 2026 fantasy baseball drafts . he's averaging 54.5 home runs, 39.5 stolen bases and 140 runs over his two Dodgers seasons . Judge has missed only 14 games over the london 2012 season .

title: What history tells us about five early-season trends
content: "Get Up" will discuss whether the Cowboys can still reach the playoffs with the "worst defense in football" it's typical to hear a lot about the pace of certain stats . but most of the time when you see "on pace for" stats, you have no idea which teams and players were on pace for similar things in the past .

title: Latest Madden ratings: Puka Nacua rises, Lamar Jackson falls
content: this week saw big gains for the new England Patriots across the board . 10 players getting ratings boosts and just two dropping a point or two . the Baltimore Ravens are in the opposite position, with 10 of their players dropping in points .

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in game 1 of the 2025 WNBA Finals . Dana Evans scored 21 points off the bench, matching the game high of four-time MVP A'ja Wilson and Mercury star Kahleah Copper . jewell Loyd also added 18 points, making them the first pair of teammates with at least 15 points as reserves in a Finals game since 2019 .

title: Bama's shot at revenge, high stakes in the ACC and the 29 biggest games of Week 6
content: it feels like we know less about the college football landscape now than we did a month ago . it's into this murky world that we wade for Week 6 . last week boasted serious headliners that clarified the Big Ten's hierarchy .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Gaza peace plan: PM Modi welcomes President Trump’s leadership amid ‘decisive’ progress in Gaza
content: The Prime Minister referred to the indications of the release of Israeli hostages by Hamas and said it marks a significant step forward in efforts to restore peace in the region

title: TMC, BJP step up political activities after Durga Puja in West Bengal
content: While the BJP leadership was huddled in a meeting with newly appointed election observers in Kolkata, the Trinamool Congress has announced an outreach of Vijaya Sammilani in all blocks across the State.

title: Two Indian tourists sentenced to jail for robbing, assaulting sex workers in Singapore hotels
content: The actions of Arokkiyasami Daison and Rajendran Mayilarasan came to light when a victim confided in another man about assaulting sex workers the following day, prompting the police to be called

title: Assam to set up judicial commission to probe Zubeen Garg's death; ED, I-T likely to join inquiry
content: Chief Minister Sarma said the commission will be headed by Justice Soumitra Saikia of the Gauhati High Court

title: In Karur, where there was no way out
content: On September 27, thousands of people gathered in Karur, Tamil Nadu, to attend a rally by actor-turned-politician Vijay. As the chief of the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party arrived hours late, the crowd swelled and surged towards his vehicle, triggering a stampede that killed 41 people and injured over 100. C. Jaisankar and Nacchinarkkiniyan M. report on the tragedy, caused by many factors, including poor planning and alleged security lapses

title: CM to inaugurate Katpadi’s first government hospital
content: The hospital will boast separate sections for cardiology, neurology, paediatrics, nephrology, obstetrics, and gynaecology. It will also have separate wards for emergency and accident cases

title: Durga Puja is over, but Bengal colleges yet to complete undergraduate admissions
content: The State Government will be finally closing the centralised admission portal on October 10, and it has asked colleges to individually fill up vacant seats after that date and complete the whole process by November 7.

title: Vijayawada Utsav a cover for TDP’s loot, alleges  YSRCP leader
content: TDP leaders had collected somewhere between ₹70 crore and ₹100 crore from businesses, hotels, hospitals, and real estate firms in the name of Vijayawada Utsav, alleges Devineni Avinash

title: Water Metro to commence services to Mattancherry from mid-October
content: ‘Up to three ferries can berth at the floating pontoons at Mattancherry at a time, with one allowed to remain overnight, making it one of the biggest terminals’; ferries to run every 20 to 30 minutes

title: BIE releases tentative timetable for Intermediate Public Exams- 2026
content: Intermediate first-year students will write their exams from February 23 to March 24, while the final-year students will write their papers from February 24 to March 23

title: APSCHE launches portal to build link between colleges, industries
content: Operating guidelines for the admission process of CETs- 2025, in compliance with the orders of the A.P. High Court, have also been released

title: BJD accuses BJP government of complicity in recruitment scam in Odisha
content: The regional party demanded a CBI inquiry into the job scam which it alleged was murkier than Vyapam scam of Madhya Pradesh

title: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister seeks French investments, highlights growth opportunities
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar pitches the State as an ideal destination for foreign investment in agriculture, electronics, green energy, and pharmaceuticals during a roadshow in Paris

title: Karur stampede: Court dismisses anticipatory bail pleas of TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Nirmal Kumar
content: Justice M. Jothiraman dismissed the pleas, taking into consideration the gravity of the incident, and that the probe was at a preliminary stage, and the injured were still in hospital.

title: Mixed response to officials handling the media briefing on the Karur stampede
content: Opinion is divided among former civil servants and commentators. Some feel that the officials should not be involved in political matters and the political executive should be accountable for the whole episode. But some others see nothing wrong in what the officials have done

title: Karnataka sees sharp rise in road accidents; Bengaluru among top five cities
content: Among 53 cities across India, Bengaluru ranked in the top five with a 30.3% increase in accidents; it was preceded by Ranchi (50.3%), Varanasi (46.3%), and Pune (35%)

title: Thirumavalavan’s call for action against Vijay ends speculation on a likely alliance with TVK
content: VCK general secretary D. Ravikumar says that Thirumavalavan   tried to be soft on the account of Mr. Vijay’s inexperience in politics, but changed his mind after listening to his video statement, in which he alluded to a conspiracy behind the death of 41 persons in the stampede at Karur

title: Mamata Banerjee attacks Centre-run Damodar Valley Corporation for water release from dams during heavy rain alert
content: Districts like Purba Bardhaman, Hooghly, Howrah, Murshidabad, and parts of Paschim Midnapore especially vulnerable to flooding, district and police officials on high alert, says Waterways and Irrigation Minister

title: Former Rajasthan Assembly Speaker Girraj Prasad Tiwari passes away at 105
content: Former CM Ashok Gehlot said Mr. Tiwari, who lived a splendid life up to the age of 105, was an example of discipline and vivacity

title: Pilots welfare group meets government agency probing AI 171 crash
content: Airline Pilots’ Association (ALPA)-India demands observer status in the probe to ensure accountability and transparency. After meeting AAIB and DGCA chiefs, its president, Captain Sam Thomas, says the association has been assured of quarterly meetings.

title: Cough syrups not contaminated, says Centre; T.N. test detects adulteration
content: Union Health Ministry says none of the cough syrup samples contained diethylene glycol or ethylene glycol that are known to cause serious kidney injury; Tamil Nadu says tests showed Coldrif batch had diethylene glycol, orders production halt

title: Mirwaiz allowed to visit Jama Masjid after 3 weeks, condemns coercive measures
content: Restrictions serve no purpose except to highlight the arbitrariness and high handedness of those wanting to rule by force rather than in the spirit of democracy, the Mirwaiz said

title: Centre fines ‘Drishti IAS’ for misleading advertisements
content: This is the second penalty imposed on Drishti IAS for similar conduct after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) had fined the institute ₹3 lakh in September 2024

title: Book listing ‘set of 21 copper plate inscriptions’ to be brought out soon
content: To be released by the Prime Minister on October 16; Archaeological Survey of India says it will contain inscriptions belonging to Vijayanagara, Reddi, Gajapati, Recharla Chiefs, Reddis of Rajamahendravarma, and Chamgalva dynasties and Nawabs of Kurnool

title: Srisailam temple restoration works sticking to original architectural style
content: The works are likely to be completed in the next six months and will ensure that the temple structure remains strong for the next 200 years without any further repairs, says K. Munirathnam Reddy, Director (Epigraphy), ASI Mysuru

title: Schools reopen up to Class 8 in Leh; L-G reviews security
content: Schools reopened a day after 26 local people, arrested for participating in the protests, were released from the Leh jail

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu expresses displeasure over conduct of some MLAs in Assembly
content: In-charge Ministers should take total responsibility for maintaining discipline among the MLAs and preventing repeated lapses, he says

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet approves SPV for expediting Amaravati capital projects
content: It also gives its nod to Land Incentive for Technical Hubs Policy 2024–29, financial assistance of ₹15,000 per year to auto and cab drivers, Caravan Tourism, and AMRUT 2.0 works

title: Talks continue as India and China plan to restart flights from October 26
content: Ministry of Civil Aviation has approved China Eastern’s plans for Shanghai-Delhi flights; industry sources say these will be five flights a week; China Southern and Air China have flights planned from Guangzhou and Beijing

title: Houses set ablaze on Assam-Nagaland border
content: Armed miscreants attacked a minority-dominated village in the disputed B Sector of the border in the Golaghat district

title: After multiple delays, Social and Educational Survey to begin in GBA limits on Saturday
content: Enumerators did not turn up citing that they were not given options to select their desired locations, says a corporation official

title: Parties banking on women for poll gains in Bihar
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar transferred ₹10,000 to the bank account of 25 lakh women across the State under Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojna

title: Man gets 67-year RI for kidnapping and raping pavement-dwelling child
content: A fine of ₹72,000 slapped on convict. He spirited the child away from her parents sleeping in a plastic tent by a roadin the city. Court hails Civil Police Officer Janosh for persevering with the search and tracing the two-year-old child

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu congratulates GCC on winning the ‘Business Line Changemaker Award’ for Araku Coffee
content: Since obtaining the Geographical Indication tag, Araku Coffee has emerged as a prominent international brand, says the Chief Minister

title: Brain-dead woman’s organs donated in Kozhikode
content: All arrangements for completing the organ donation procedure were coordinated by the Kerala State Organ and Tissue Transplantation Organisation

title: From dropout crisis to model campus: Karnataka headmaster turns village school into success with ₹3 crore CSR support
content: The funds raised were used to expand the campus to 22 classrooms spread across three new blocks, set up smart boards, STEM and computer labs, build an auditorium, and improve sanitation.

title: Legality alone does not make a law just, says CJI
content: Chief Justice draws parallels between sedition, slavery and colonial laws branding tribes as criminals

title: No clarity yet on land acquisition for Sabari rail as Collectors await Railways’ reply
content: Collectors of Ernakulam and Kottayam wrote to the Southern Railway a month ago seeking the proposals which are a prerequisite to initiate land acquisition

title: Ruling JD(U) MLA joins RJD just ahead of Bihar election
content: The entry of Mr. Kumar, hailing from Bhumihar caste, is seen as a boost for Leader of the Opposition in the State Tejashwi Yadav, who has been working hard to expand the RJD’s support base beyond its traditional Muslim-Yadav (MY) base

title: Vembanad lake a hotspot for leptospirosis, say researchers
content: The findings indicate that leptospirosis persists in the waterbody during all seasons, with cases surging during the rainy season as human contact with contaminated water increases

title: Bombay HC reserves order on Hany Babu’s bail plea in Bhima Koregaon case
content: DU professor in custody for over five years; defence cites delay in framing of charges, NIA opposes plea

title: Flying Wedge Defence & Aerospace offers to set up unit in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Bengaluru-based firm is keen on establishing an Autonomous Combat Aircraft Manufacturing & Testing facility in Anantapur district

title: Karur stampede: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court declines to order CBI probe
content: The court also directs the State government not to grant permission to any political party or organisation for conducting public meetings on National or State Highways till the standard operating procedures (SOPs) are in place

title: Niti Aayog pitches for presumptive taxation scheme for foreign investors
content: The working paper noted that despite India’s inherent appeal and remarkable FDI growth, structural impediments such as ambiguous PE regulations introduce tax uncertainty and dampen investments

title: ‘Vision 2031’ unveils blueprint for inclusive growth
content: State-level seminar launched to frame development roadmap for the next decade rooted in social justice and equity

title: Three arrested in Chittoor gang-rape case of minor Dalit girl
content: The accused, employed as loan recovery agents, used to target lone women and couples in secluded parks, secretly recording them to extort money, says the SP
